datafield.subfield: HADRON EMISSION REACTIONS WITH INTERFERING GLUONS

00001 The differential cross-section, $\der\sigma/\der\qsq$, observed in the two ranges in scattering angles \ttag studied, compared to the predictions of the HERWIG+\kt and PHOJET models. The cross-sections are given in the kinematical ranges described in the text. The errors are statistical only.

00002 The HERWIG+\kt energy flow, \flow, at the hadron level (lightly shaded) as well as on detector level (darkly shaded), as measured by the three detectors. The coverage of the different detector components are indicated by dot-dashed lines. In the case of L3 the ALR is not used in this analysis.

00003 The HERWIG+\kt energy flow, \flow, at the hadron level (lightly shaded) as well as on detector level (darkly shaded), as measured by the three detectors. The coverage of the different detector components are indicated by dot-dashed lines. In the case of L3 the ALR is not used in this analysis.

00004 The HERWIG+\kt energy flow, \flow, at the hadron level (lightly shaded) as well as on detector level (darkly shaded), as measured by the three detectors. 00006 The HERWIG+\kt and PHOJET correction factors, $f$, for the ALEPH, L3 and OPAL energy flow for the low-\qsq region. The symbols are slightly displaced for better visibility. The vertical lines indicate the central rapidity region, $|\eta|&lt;1.735$.

38 pages, 25 figures, Submitted to Eur. Phys. J. C

Deep inelastic electron-photon scattering is studied in the Q**2 range from 1.2 to 30 GeV**2 using the LEP1 data taken with the ALEPH, L3 and OPAL detectors at centre-of-mass energies close to the mass of the Z boson. Distributions of the measured hadronic final state are corrected to the hadron level and compared to the predictions of the HERWIG and PHOJET Monte Carlo models. For large regions in most of the distributions studied the results of the different experiments agree with one another. However, significant differences are found between the data and the models. Therefore the combined LEP data serve as an important input to improve on the Monte Carlo models.

CERN-LEP. Measurements of various hadronic final state distributions in deep inelastic electron-photon interactions resulting from single tagged E+E- interactions at energies close to that of the Z boson. The analysis is from the LEP Working Group on Two-Pohotn Physics combining the ALEPH, L3 and OPAL data..
Comparison of deep inelastic electron photon scattering data with the HERWIG and PHOJET Monte Carlo models
Comparison of deep inelastic electron photon scattering data with the HERWIG and PHOJET Monte Carlo models.
Comparison of Deep Inelastic Electron-Photon Scattering Data with the Herwig and Phojet Monte Carlo Models
interpretation of experiments: CERN LEP Stor
